thread.title: North Korean ambassador arrives at Wisma Putra
thread.title_full: North Korean ambassador arrives at Wisma Putra

author: RAZAK AHMAD
title: North Korean ambassador arrives at Wisma Putra
text:
Monday, 20 February 2017 | MYT 10:04 AM North Korean ambassador arrives at Wisma Putra by razak ahmad 
PUTRAJAYA: North Korea's Ambassador to Malaysia Kang Chol has arrived at Wisma Putra to meet with Foreign Ministry officials. 
Kang, who arrived at 9.54am in his official car, had been summoned to Wisma Putra after he criticised Malaysia for refusing to release the body of Kim Jong-nam, the murdered half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un. 
In a strongly worded statement last Friday, the ambassador expressed dissatisfaction with Wisma Putra and the police over Jong-nam's postmortem. 
He said he had demanded the release of the body without delay and claimed the embassy's request was rejected despite submitting official documents to the Foreign Ministry. 
Jong-nam, 45, was killed by two women who splashed his face with a chemical at the Kuala Lumpur International Airport 2 (KLIA2) departure hall at about 9am last Monday. He was about to leave for Macau. 
Four people have so far been arrested in the probe into his death. 
Last Wednesday, the first suspect, who holds a Vietnamese passport bearing the name Doan Thi Huong, was arrested at KLIA2 as she was preparing to board a flight to Vietnam. 
A day later, Indonesian Siti Aisyah was arrested at a hotel in Ampang at 2am. 
Police said she was identified based on CCTV footage at the airport and was alone at the time of arrest. 
Her boyfriend was also picked up by police to assist with investigations. 
Siti Aisyah had taken a taxi from a hotel in Bandar Baru Salak Tinggi to the airport that day. 
The fourth suspect arrested over the assassination has been identified as North Korean Ri Jong-chol, from Pyongyang. 
The 47-year-old man, who has expertise in chemistry, was detained after police raided a condominium in Jalan Kuchai Lama on Friday.
